instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
This is an interesiting Case:

I2C lines are fine
feedback is fine
sense cuircuit had broken traces (to the shunt resistor)
made those connections again
the screen is working. I tested it
on the backlight output i have 11.7V
i have found out that if i measure <RESISTOR>R7702</RESISTOR> on pin 2 (with a multimeter) the backlight starts working. So i changed <RESISTOR>R7702</RESISTOR>. But still the same issue.
I have also changed the following parts: <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>, <DIODE>D7710</DIODE>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7701</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7700</CAPACITOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR>

i am a little lost. What could be the issue here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
Replace all resistors around <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>.
Re-check all solders and traces.
